result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Austin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Austin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Austin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court vacated the previous plea and defendant entered a plea of guilty as to the Amended Charge.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $200.00  including all applicable costs and surcharges by 8/18/15.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Michael Austin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Sarra Mae Kiaie for Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Final review held.  Defendant is compliant with deferred prosecution agreement.  On motion of the State, Court ordered the previous plea vacated and the charge amended to Child Neglect, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.21(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Michael Austin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has 2 minor conditions to complete.  State requests an additional review date to allow for the defendant to complete these conditions.  Matter rescheduled for another review hearing in Br. 40.  Review hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Br. 40 not in session on day this case is calendared for a review.  Matter transferred to Br. 4

Defendant Michael Austin in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Review hearing on deferred prosection agreement held.  Defendant is compliant to date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Review hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court modified the no contact order to a No Violent Contact Order.

Defendant Michael Austin in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Wiaver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  Filed, signed Child Abuse Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  
The Court reviewed the Intake Requirement and Further Conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended for a period of twelve months.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Austin in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defense is checking into a deferred prosecution agreement and needs more time.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

Defendant Michael Austin in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Parties are still in negotiations and would like an adjournment.  Court granted the request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
On motion of the defense, Court modified to allow for SUPERVISED ONLY visits with N.A.

Defendant Michael Austin in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Information received and filed. Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.   Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Due to the ADA assignment, this matter is retabbed to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.

Defendant Michael Austin in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Kristin M Schrank for Matthew Torbens on appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 23.  State does not have their file today.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with N.A. dob 12-15-2013.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Austin in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Michael Austin in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
